intro: Lasia merkusii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its leaves are velvety and often have a dark green hue with a waxy surface. Lasia merkusii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
